newsitem.title: YEMEN: Yemeni president to go on pilgrimage to Saudi.
newsitem.headline: Yemeni president to go on pilgrimage to Saudi.

text.p: Yemeni President Ali Abdullah Saleh was due to travel to neighbouring Saudi Arabia on Saturday to make a pilgrimage to the Moslem holy city of Mecca, an official told Reuters.

"(Saleh) will depart for the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia later today (Saturday) to perform the Umra," the official said, referring to a minor pilgrimage which can take place at any time of the year. The Umra takes just over an hour to accomplish.
"We expect President Saleh to meet with senior Saudi officials during his short visit to the kingdom," he said, but gave no further details.

Yemen and Saudi Arabia are exerting efforts to settle a 60-year-old border dispute, which led to several minor clashes in the potentially oil and gas-rich area before the two sides signed a memorandum of understanding in 1995 to resolve the row.
